headline: A free online course on the logical design and implementation of digital circuits and number systems.

You will learn about the minimization of logical expressions using the design of combinational and sequential circuits. You will also be able to explain the application of number systems, as well as building algorithms in Verilog, a hardware description language (HDL).

courseDescription:
Digital circuits and systems is a free online course that begins by introducing you to the basic building blocks in the design and construction of digital circuits. The course will also introduce you to the terminologies used and basic Boolean theorems, as well as the universality of logic gates. You will also learn about combinational circuits and the process of designing a digital circuit. The minimization of logical expressions, as well as a brief introduction to Verilog, will be covered in this course.


The material then explains the basic sequential elements, as well as latches and flip-flops as building blocks in sequential circuits. You will learn about assignment statements and instantiation, as well as the basis of building a hierarchical design. This course will teach you about the importance of complementary metal-oxide-semiconductor (CMOS), as well as give you a brief description of a transistor. Verilog style mixing and an introduction to finite state machines will also be analysed in this course.


Furthermore, you will get familiar with the design and implementation of the greatest common divisor (GCD) algorithm, as well as its translation to Verilog for communication with hardware. You will learn about the instantiation of a controller and data path, as well as the connection between the elements with an interface description. This free online course will be of great benefit to IT students, researchers and anyone with an interest in digital circuits and systems. You can start learning about digital circuits and number systems today.

modules.details: Introduction to Boolean Logic and Terminologies
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the fundamentals of building blocks in the design of a digital circuit. You will also be introduced to the basic boolean theorems, as well as the associate techniques used in digital circuits. An understanding of Verilog as a hardware description language will also be covered in this module.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the concept of universality, as well as its importance in a circuit design. You will also be introduced to the basics of Karnaugh maps and using it in boolean representation. The minimization of multiple-output, as well as the implementation of number systems, will also be covered in this module.
topics: Boolean Functions and Truth Tables - Learning Outcomes
Boolean Functions and Truth Tables - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Design and Analysis of Combinational Circuits
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the application of combinational circuits, as well as determining the potency of combinational logic designs. You will also be introduced to the universality of multiplexers and demultiplexers. The design process of a circuit, as well as the process of writing Verilog codes, will also be analyzed in the module.
topics: Design and Analysis of Combinational Circuits - Learning Outcomes
Compiling and Running Verilog - A Demonstration
Design and Analysis of Combinational Circuits - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Design and Analysis of Sequential Elements
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the fundamentals and applications of sequential elements in a gated latch. You will also be introduced to the application of registers in sequential circuits. The concepts of Flip-flop, as well as assignment statements and instantiation, will also be covered in this module.
topics: Design and analysis of Basic Sequential Elements - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to finite state machines, as well as the special class of circuits. You will also be introduced to the techniques for solving problems, as well as state minimization in circuits. The process of timing sequential circuits and Verilog styles will also be covered in this module.

modules.name: Module

You will also be introduced to the application of a controller in GCD machines, as well as the rudiments of the data path.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the concept of pipelining in digital circuit design, as well as the methodology for pipelining circuits. You will also be introduced to the latency and throughput of a K-pipeline. The algorithms and syntax of assignments in Verilog will also be covered in this module.
